instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B shows 100% all the time
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B shows 100% all the time
threads.message: Are all details about the battery displayed? Cycle count, full charge capacity, etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B shows 100% all the time
threads.message: ok on external system it shows actual precent and displays all details though charging NO and no orange led.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B shows 100% all the time
threads.message: Sense resistors or traces <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52, the usual. Check that PPBUS is 12.56V and not 12.23V too without battery connected.
